Details are accurate to the time of collation (October 2022). # Masterlist of Tags ## A - [Aged care](topics/aged-pallcare.md) #agedcare

/cpd/aphasia/attention-memory-aphasia.title: Attention, memory and aphasia: Implications
/cpd/aphasia/attention-memory-aphasia.content:
Tags: #aphasia #language

Code: O

Type: Live online event (Past event)

Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

Description: Evidence from aphasia literature supports the proposition that cognitive processes, such as attention and memory, influence language production and comprehension. To elucidate these relationships, this event will discuss models of attention and memory, review assessment practices and present treatment approaches.

< Home

/cpd/dysphagia/dysphagia-riskfeed-pallca.title: Dysphagia management and risk feeding in aged or palliative care
/cpd/dysphagia/dysphagia-riskfeed-pallca.content:
Tags: #dysphagia #riskfeeding #agedcare #pallcare

Code: O

Type: Live online event (Nov 2022) (Runs over 2 sessions)

Cost: $110

Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

Description: Participants will reflect on knowledge of normal swallowing in older people, consider risk in dysphagia management and be able to demonstrate patient-focused, evidenced-based treatment of dysphagia in these settings.

< Home

/cpd/langlit/sounds-write.title: Sounds Write
/cpd/langlit/sounds-write.content:
Tags: #literacy #language #dyslexia

Code: O

Type: Live online workshops (Feb 2023)

Website: SPELD NSW

Description: Sounds-Write is an evidence-based highly structured, synthetic, linguistic phonics program utilising an exciting and highly successful approach to the teaching of reading and spelling. Sounds-Write is developmentally appropriate for beginning readers in Kindergarten, Year 1 and Year 2 within a classroom, and also offers fast and highly effective small group or individual intervention for children at all year levels who have fallen behind in their reading and spelling from Year 3 onwards.

< Home

/cpd/langlit/talk-for-writing.title: Talk for Writing
/cpd/langlit/talk-for-writing.content:
Tags: #language #literacy

Code: O

Type: Live online workshops (Mar 2023)

Website: Dyslexia — SPELD Foundation

Description: Talk for Writing is a unique process that uses spoken activities to develop writing skills. Quality writing is created by first expanding and developing students’ oral language skills and then teaching the necessary steps for exceptional sentence, paragraph and text construction.

/cpd/nd/autism-national-guideline.title: Implementing the National Guideline for the Diagnosis of ASD
/cpd/nd/autism-national-guideline.content:
Tags: #autism

Code: O

Type: Self-paced online course (4 hours to complete)

Cost: $75

Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

Description: The course delivers a consistent overview of the entire clinical pathway with deeper dives highlighting the importance of a speech pathologists’ role, from assessment of functioning to sharing findings. The learning framework and module objectives will assist learners to align their practice with the Guideline recommendations.

< Home

/cpd/speech/lsvt.title: LSVT Loud
/cpd/speech/lsvt.content:
Tags: #speech #voice #progneuro #dysarthria #congenital

Code: O

Type:

  • In-person or online certification
  • Some free webinars

Website: LSVT Website

Description: A speech treatment with current and emerging evidence for the following populations:

  • adults
    • Parkinson's disease
    • some atypical Parkinsonians
    • multiple sclerosis
    • stroke
    • ataxia
  • children
    • cerebral palsy
    • Down's syndrome

< Home

/cpd/speech/prompt.title: PROMPT
/cpd/speech/prompt.content:
Tags: #cas #autism #congenital #speech

Code: O

Type: Online or in-person

Website: The PROMPT Institute

Description: PROMPT is widely accepted as a treatment method for children ages 6 months and older who may have autism, apraxia, dysarthria, cerebral palsy, or other motor speech disorders. The PROMPT method centers on a tactile-kinesthetic approach to speech therapy. To become PROMPT Certified, a clinician must complete four essential steps to be able to fully understand the PROMPT technique and apply it appropriately to clients/patients. All PROMPT training begins with the Intro workshop which may be taken in-person, online through Zoom, or via ten online modules.
